data.title: Detroit 313 Day events include $3.13 food deals, music, brews
data.meta_description: March 13, also known as 313 Day, is a day to celebrate the city of Detroit and its famous area code.
data.text:
DETROIT – March 13, also known as 313 Day, is a day to celebrate the city of Detroit and its famous area code.

Get ready because 313 Day is coming up on Wednesday with a whole bunch of events and deals, including food and drinks for $3.13, music, brews and more.

Detroit’s Atwater Brewing will celebrate with an event beginning at 5 p.m. at the taphouse at 237 Joseph Campau, WXYZ Detroit reports. It includes pints, empanadas from Empacho Detroit and Detroit-style chocolates from Bon Bon Bon, and several menu items all discouted to $3.13. Attendees will also have a chance to win a Detroit-themed basket with items like Detroit Tigers ticket, Hell Fire Detroit hot sauces, 313 Chips, McClure’s Pickles and Bloody Mary Mix and Detroit Hustles Harder swag.

A party featuring music, comedy trivia and more will begin at 3:13 p.m. at Robert C. Valade Park, 2670 Atwater St., WDIV Local 4 reports. Hosted by WDIV, Detroit Riverfront Conservancy and Raise the Flag, this free event will include musical performances from Drummer B, My Detroit Players w/ Nick Speed, Al Bettis, Asklepius, George Montrelle, Cloudyyy and Brizzl.

Shinola Hotel in downtown Detroit is also getting in the 313 spirit with food and beverage deals and a DJ set. The hotel, 1400 Woodward Ave., will host Detroit DJ Stacy Hale in the Living Room bar from 6-9 p.m. At on-site restaurant Mister Dips, all menu items will be $3.13 all day. The on-site beer hall, The Brakeman, will offer three drink tokens for $13, good to use on draft beer and craft cocktails.

Another free event encourages healthy living. The 313 Day Detroit Health and Wellness Fair, 9928 Grand River Ave., is scheduled for 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Explore vendor booths with information about exercise, healthy eating, stress management and more.

McDonald’s restaurants in Metro Detroit are also hopping on the 313 Day celebration train, the Detroit Free Press reports. Thirty-five locations in the 313, 248, 734 and 586 area codes will be serving Vernor’s Boston coolers, which is made with the iconic Detroit ginger ale and ice cream. Participating locations will also have a limited supply of long-sleeve T-shirts from The Dirt Label, of Royal Oak. Here are the participating locations:
